definition: -ly/structural particle: used before a verb or adjective, linking it to preceding modifying adverbial adjunct

sentences.english: Thick-lipped urns will sweat in the fragrant cellars.
sentences.chinese: 厚口的瓦罐会在芳香的地窖中流汗。

sentences.english: Many of the people of Darwin escaped by hiding in cellars that night.
sentences.chinese: 那晚，达尔文市的许多市民是躲在地窖里逃过此劫的。

sentences.english: We scattered the rat poison around the cellar floor.
sentences.chinese: 我们在地窖里到处撒下了耗子药。

sentences.english: The tomb of Filippo Brunelleschi in the crypt.
sentences.chinese: 地窖下布鲁内黎斯基的墓地。

sentences.english: Put him in the cellar, papa.
sentences.chinese: 把他放到地窖里去吧，爸爸。

sentences.english: The wine has been cellared for ten years.
One day my wife accompanied me into the cellar.
sentences.chinese: 一天，我妻子跟着我到地窖去办点事。

sentences.english: Luckily our cellar was still full of potatoes, so we lived on potatoes with salt.
sentences.chinese: 幸好地窖里存满了马铃薯，于是我们以盐焗土豆为食。

sentences.english: Tied to a corner of the cellar, such as the ants when Mr Zhang is flustered.
sentences.chinese: 被绑在地窖一角如百蚁闹心的张志强气急败坏。

sentences.english: The consul's consultant hauled out the assaulter from the vault.
sentences.chinese: 领事的顾答把攻击者从地窖外拖了出来。

sentences.english: Its walls were loosely constructed, and had lately been plastered throughout with a rough plaster.
sentences.chinese: 地窖的墙壁结构很松，最近刚刚用粗灰泥粉刷过。

sentences.english: Some people dig cellars where they keep their potatoes and root vegetables.
sentences.chinese: 一些人把他们的马铃薯和根类蔬菜放在地窖里保藏。

sentences.english: They had some wines down cellar.
sentences.chinese: 他们在地窖里储存了一些酒。

sentences.english: The cellar floods whenever it rains heavily.
sentences.chinese: 这个密封的门不允许水进地窖。

sentences.english: Under our house is a cellar in which the coal was kept.
sentences.chinese: 我们的房子下面是一个装煤的地窖。

sentences.english: They laid up a store of vegetables in the cellar.
sentences.chinese: 他们在地窖里贮藏了蔬菜。

definition: a room for keeping sth hidden/secret room/hidden chamber
jug (earthenware with a big belly and a small opening)
